flawed_nl_solution:
One-third of her bonus was $900/3 = $<<900/3=300>>300.
After one year, stock A doubled in value and was worth $300*2 = $<<300*2=600>>600.
After one year, stock B doubled in value and was worth $300*2 = $<<300*2=600>>600.
After one year, stock C had lost half its value and was worth $300/2 = $<<300/2=510>>510.
Altogether, at the end of the year, Gwen's stocks were worth $600+$600+$510 = $<<600+600+510=1710>>1710
#### 1710

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 150, not 510. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
